reviews.text: My wife and I along with another couple were traveling by car to Bayeux for a Normandy tour and to see the Tapestry. All of the "downtown" hotels and B&B's seemed overpriced to me so I broadened my search a bit geographically since we had a car and came upon the Capanille which appeared to be on the edge of town and a motel type facility with the right price. As we approached town from the direction of St. Lo, we found it literally on the roundabout and what appeared to be its own exit (actually it was a minor street which passed by the hotel). We checked in and were pleased to be in a very acceptable, clean facility with plenty of room and comfortable beds. Our view from our room was across a verdant pasture with our own four dairy cows beyond the hedge and a great view of the Bayeux Cathedral. We set out to find the tour pickup point for the following morning and discovered that from our roundabout, it was about 300-400 yards to the next roundabout and we were on the street which passed the cathedral , the main tourist facilities, two blocks from the Bayeux Tapestry, the tourist information office, the parking lot, and our tour pickup point (other tours were also picking up at the same spot). I was delighted to find it was so close as I had expected to be a couple of miles out of town. More serious walkers than me might consider the hotel to be in walking distance. The hotel had a restaurant that was certainly competive in quality and price with other places we ate. I was also pleased with the booking procedure which I handled through a company called Activa. I booked 3 nights and found I had made an error on the date. Through the booking website, I easily changed the date. Later we had to adjust our schedule due to problems with the tour we wanted and again a couple of clicks and the adjustment was made with no problem. They accepted major credit cards so no problem with looking for ATM's. Tip: When exiting the second roundabout toward "centre" about a block on the right is the entry to a free parking lot which is about 2 blocks from the tapestry and another 2 blocks from the tour pickup. The tour pickup is within a couple of blocks of everywhere in town where a tourist would go.
reviews.title: Only stay here if you really have too!

reviews.text: The price of the room the same as Premier Inn,but not as good as value,the rooms are small,and in the heat you stand a chance of sufocating,with shutters down and very little air,and the aircon did not work! Breakfast is 9 euro's,much cheaper in town.Dinner my advice don't have the buffett,food is fine,but very expensive,7 euros for a pint!!! In the lovely sun,there is no where to sit outside, a major fall down on there behalf. The plus to this hotel is that the town centre was only a 10min walk away!!!
reviews.title: Good for a short D Day tour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights in Bayeux in late September. We felt the motel was a good value for the price, although the room was small even by French standards. It was very clean and quiet and we had no problems seeing the sites in Bayeux even though the motel is located about 15 min. from town. At the second roundabout from the hotel, there is a free parking lot behind the Bayeux Tapestry Musuem. From there, you can walk all over town. We also parked in this lot when we went on our all day D-Day Beaches Tour. We ate one night in the restaurant and I would rate the restaurant as only average. We did not find the female receptionist very helpful. She could not point out on the map where the square was where we were to meet for our D-Day Tour nor would she make the local phone call to confirm our tour the following day. She wasn't rude, but I felt she did not want to be bothered. We went to the Tourist Information office where they confirmed the tour for us and indicated where we should meet.
reviews.title: Clean Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I mean, it was ok...clean and comfortable. VERY quiet. It was just not like other hotels, in that it was quite stark, almost hostel like in nature. Two twin beds in a small room, and no carpet. It didn't have anything extra special that is for sure. Oh, except for crickets. It had a couple of those. Our room backed to a field with cows and frogs, which I thought was quite endearing, but then I used to live in the country. The crickets were only trouble-some at night if you had to get up and go to the bathroom, and when you turned on the light they scurried around. Kinda creepy. I think if the room you end up with is used by a lot of other people, you wouldn't have the cricket problem. Or maybe that is just the result of being next to that field. Anyway, it was ok. We survived. And slept quite well.
reviews.title: Definitely a 2-star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay here. The room was small (as are virtually all French hotel rooms), but very clean and modern. One of the nicest bathrooms we had during our trip. We did have dinner there one night, and it was very good and fairly average in price. We never bought breakfast at our hotels in France, as they are very overpriced--just buy a croissant and juice at a supermarket or bakery. We were lucky enough to stay on the side of the hotel with a lovely view of the town and cathedral over a field with a few dairy cows. Town center is about a 10 minute walk, as is the train station. Only downside is there is not a sidewalk for about 400 m of the way, so we pulled our suitcase across the gravel path with some difficulty. Hopefully they build a sidewalk soon (or maybe we should've just taken a taxi).
reviews.title: Lovely, clean, good value

reviews.text: I only stayed for one night but we used the meeting room facility and had lunch, dinner and breakfast all of which were fine. The room was small but clean and tidy.

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights using Bayeaux as our base for touring Normandy. It has it's own car park and is a short walk into the town where there is plenty of choice for dining. As an overnight stop it would be fine but would not stay 3 nights again. It is reasonable value albeit the separate cost of breakfast is excessive.
Clean and basic.
reviews.title: Budget hotel price, budget hotel accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Campanille Bayeux was easy to get to via driving. It is slightly outside the city centre so I would more highly recommend it if you are not intent on solely seeing the town of Bayeux, very good for the DDay Beaches. The staff was generally friendly. The rooms are a typical budget room in Europe- our room had 2 very narrow twin beds with a functional bathroom and tv. I would recommend asking for a room on the second floor or otherwise your room faces the street level and you must keep your blinds closed. The room was clean, albeit ageing. A good choice if you are on a budget.
reviews.title: Low cost, simple and efficient.

reviews.text: Hotel is conveniently situated on the ring road within easy walking distance of the town centre (and tapestry exhibition), D Day museum and British cemetery. Small rooms with no frills but includes free wifi, drink making equipment and biscuits, shampoos and soap, air con, mechanical blind on front window for complete darkness. Beds are comfortable on the firm side. Check in a nd reception OK. Didn't try the breakfast or evening meals, there is a supermarket half a mile up the road and reasonably priced restaurants in the town. On the rule of 'you get what you pay for' this was OK and I would recommend for anyone just looking for a bed for the night.
reviews.title: Good value Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel when visiting area with friends. Very decent rooms, clean, comfortable beds and quite spacious. Great view from upstairs over fields with view of cathedral. Breakfast extra but quite decent. About 10 minutes walk into town centre.
